page.title: 07St. Mary's Church, Longdon
page.content:
The{Longdon, Bushley, Queenhill and {Holdfast benefice}was formed in 1978. In 1960, Longdon was the first county parish in the Worcestershire Diocese to hold a{Christian Steward- {ship }campaign. This has served the parish well. There has been a strengthening of faith and a greater regard for mission amongst the small congregation. The{P.C.C.}meets all its financial obligations, including the quota mainly by free-will offerings. There is a highly valued{Womens Fellowship and a{Sunday School.
The{Vicar}is{Rural Dean}and{Bishop's {Chaplain}to the mentally handicapped who attend the Christingle-Candlemass service along with the village school children with whom strong links are maintained.
